amendment.description: To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to prioritizing taking into custody aliens charged with a crime resulting in death or serious bodily injury.

action.text: Amendment SA 132 ruled out of order by the chair.
Motion to waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 132 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 48. Record Vote Number: 25.
Point of order that the amendment violates section 305(b)(2) of the CBA raised in Senate with respect to amendment SA 132.

Amendment SA 132 proposed by Senator Ernst. (consideration: CR S440; text: CR S440) To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to prioritizing taking into custody aliens charged with a crime resulting in death or serious bodily injury.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Motion to waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 132 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 48. Record Vote Number: 25.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 132 proposed by Senator Ernst.
